casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Appellee, v. Jack Harold KOON, Appellant. No. 11623. United States Court of Appeals Fourth Circuit. Argued Dec. 4, 1967. Decided Jan. 11, 1968. Kale R. Alexander, Columbia, S. C. (David A. Fedor, Columbia, S. C., on brief), for appellant. James D. McCoy, III, Asst. U. S. Atty. (John C. Williams, U. S. Atty., on brief), for appellee.

Before HAYNSWORTH, Chief Judge, and WINTER and CRAVEN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

We find no error in the trial and conviction of the defendant for the possession of untax-paid whisky.

Affirmed.
